Job Opportunities

Project Coordinator, Collaborations and Learning Community

Job Summary

Now part of the newly announced Bloomberg Center for Cities at Harvard University, the Bloomberg Harvard City Leadership Initiative has developed resources that aim to elevate the art and science of city leadership. As interest in city leadership development is growing in countries and regions globally, more mayors and city leaders have the opportunity to learn from the Initiative by using its library of city leadership-related teaching cases and other learning materials, faculty research, and tools designed to educate city officials on leadership, management, problem-solving capabilities, use of data and evidence, innovation, negotiation, and other topics critical to leading cities. We aim to inspire others to join the effort and raise performance in the field, support them with our tools and curriculum, and bring groups to share their experiences and foster the cross-fertilization of ideas as part of a community of learning.

Job-specific Responsibilities

Reporting to the Senior Director for Collaborations and Learning Community, the Project Coordinator will be integral to a new, entrepreneurial unit formed to facilitate knowledge transfer, foster collaborations, and share lessons with a broader network of collaborators in the city leadership space throughout Harvard and beyond. Functions of this unit involve sharing materials, curricula, and insights with other institutions and deepening collaborations across Harvard University and beyond. The Project Coordinator will play a key role in supporting the Center and its leadership through:

  • Research on Collaborators: Perform background research on prospective collaborators in the field of city leadership globally and within Harvard. Advance the Center’s relationships and awareness of city leadership organizations and how their work complements ours.
  • Presentations and Reports: Draft memos, reports, guides, and presentations intended for external audiences, donor, faculty, and other leaders in the city leadership space.
  • Coordination and Follow-Up: Manage preparation (including background research), note-taking, and follow-up for high-profile meetings with faculty, collaborators, and key external audiences. Coordinate scheduling of key multi-stakeholder meetings when needed.
  • Project Management: Create and manage work plans, with keen attention to deadlines, interdependencies, and risks. Review and provide status updates to the leadership team. Contribute to the development of standard operating procedures and process improvements.
  • Convenings: Support the planning of virtual and onsite convenings and forums with individuals and organizations participating in the learning community. Manage events held at Center. Prepare briefing books.
  • Database Management: Update internal CRM to ensure accurate and timely information on collaborators and related activities.
  • Team Advancement: Contribute to a culture of excellence grounded in learning, problem solving, and teamwork. Collaborate with colleagues to identify recommendations for improvements.
  • Additional related tasks, as necessary.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree and at least 2 years of work experience, preferably in roles that interface with executive-level teams or in management consulting

Additional Qualifications and Skills

Any combination of the following is a plus:

  • Strong writing and presentation skills and the ability to communicate to different audiences persuasively, concisely, and clearly through memos, slide presentations, email, and reports
  • Demonstrated skills in collecting, analyzing, and reporting information to key stakeholders
  • Effectiveness in navigating through ambiguity and complexity
  • Track record of consistently exceeding expectations, delivering on time, and producing high-quality output
  • Highly organized with strong attention to detail
  • Ability to create project plans to track and monitor progress
  • An orientation to first-rate customer service
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
  • An orientation to working proactively to seek opportunities to support others
  • Great initiative, resourcefulness, and an enthusiasm for doing whatever it takes to get work done in a fast-paced environment
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; experience with Salesforce is a plus

Additional Information

This position is a fully benefits-eligible term appointment ending one year from date of hire with very strong possibility of renewal.

We regret that the Harvard Kennedy School does not provide Visa Sponsorship.
Harvard University requires pre-employment references and background checks.
Harvard University is committed to supporting a healthy, sustainable learning and working environment.

Please note: This is an in-person/on campus position based in Cambridge, MA, with possible flexible work options.

Harvard will require COVID vaccination for all Harvard community members who will have any on-campus presence. Individuals may claim exemption from the vaccine requirement for medical or religious reasons. More information regarding the University’s COVID vaccination requirement and exceptions may be found at the University’s “COVID-19 Vaccine Information” webpage: http://www.harvard.edu/coronavirus/covid-19-vaccine-information/.
